Key Match Events: Aiden Markram and David Miller changed gears, slammed 76 runs in 10 overs, each scored a half-century
South Africa needed 25 runs from 18 balls, took 13 off Ashwin and even though he dismissed Tristan Stubbs, it was too little, too late
Pre-Game Insights: India had theirs over Pakistan last week but now South Africa have showed they know how to deal with pressure
South Africa set the tone in the field. Their fast men were exceptional and used the short ball to excellent effect
India's attack were also outstanding for the most part. They made use of fuller lengths and found swing
South Africa's spinners haven't done too badly against a line-up that looked to target them
South Africa won by five wickets (with two balls remaining)
Post-Match Reflections: This result has big implications for the rest of the group, particularly Pakistan, whose semi-final hopes are hanging by a thread
South Africa's win means that not only do Pakistan have to beat South Africa on Thursday but also hope either India lose to Bangladesh and Zimbabwe or South Africa are defeated by the Netherlands
Aiden Markram and David Miller's partnership broke the back of the chase. It's South Africa's match to lose now
Miscellaneous Highlights: Temba Bavuma can't catch a break with the bat and failed again but made the right decision to only use Keshav Maharaj for three overs, while giving Aiden Markram one
South Africa's fast men were exceptional and used the short ball to excellent effect
India's attack made use of fuller lengths and found swing
South Africa needed 25 runs from 18 balls. They took 13 off Ashwin and even though he dismissed Tristan Stubbs, it was too little, too late
Others: Rain delays led to the game being postponed until the next day
The team ended a 20-year championship drought
This was the 100th meeting between the two teams
